thread.title: Virginia Searches for First ACC Win Against Syracuse
thread.title_full: Virginia Searches for First ACC Win Against Syracuse

title: Virginia Searches for First ACC Win Against Syracuse
text:
Virginia Searches for First ACC Win Against Syracuse Posted: Virginia has been outscored 112-37 in the first and third quarters combined CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va (WVIR) - 
Virginia has been outscored 112-37 in the first and third quarters but has outscored its opponents 74-67 in the second and fourth quarters. Its evident UVa struggles to start halves. The 'Hoos know that in order to turn things around at the mid point of the season, they'll need to play a complete football game. 
Head coach Mike London says, "The question was asked, 'how to do we make sure that we start fast or we stay on target or focus.' We stay on focus as far as who are responsibilities are." 
Despite a 1-4 record, nobody in UVA's locker room is hitting the panic button. The players and coaches believe they are just one or two plays away from having one or two more wins this season. 
Trent Corney says, "If we all make one or two, or even one more play, then we would of won the game. I'm not the only guy that believes we need to make more plays." 
Jackson Matteo says, "Notre Dame was a tough game. Pittsburgh was a tough game. We're in those games. Like you said one or two more plays, but we're not changing anything. We're ready to go this week." 
Virginia has 1-6 record when facing a new ACC program for the first time. They face Syracuse for the first time in conference play. The Orange have a record of 3-2, 1-0 ACC and almost upset 6th ranked LSU. 
London says, "They played a very inspired game against number six LSU. Definitely, into the third and fourth quarter when things started to get away. Coach Schaffer is a good football coach. He's a good man and I know that he'll have the team ready to play." 
Matteo says, "They run a 4-3, similar to Pitt. I've been watching film. I know the offensive line has been too. We're ready to go as far as our jobs are concerned." 
Virginia and Syracuse kick off Saturday at 3:30 p.m. from Scott Stadium. Virginia Searches for First ACC Win Against Syracuse More>>
